disease.label: Intellectual developmental disorder with dysmorphic facies and behavioral abnormalities

term.label: Intellectual developmental disorder with dysmorphic facies and behavioral abnormalities

resources.name: An Online Catalog of Human Genes and Genetic Disorders

externalReferences.description: De Novo Variants in the F-Box Protein FBXO11 in 20 Individuals with a Variable Neurodevelopmental Disorder

query:
From the following patient information, what is the most likely diagnosis? Use multiple queries or reasoning steps as necessary, and provide a rank-ordered list of up to 10 diagnoses, even if there is insufficient information to make a definitive diagnosis. If you are unsure, provide a list of possible diagnoses with the most likely one first.

Patient ID: Individual 4
Patient age: 8 years
Patient sex: Male
Patient features: Microcephaly, Hypotonia, Autistic behavior, Global developmental delay, Delayed ability to walk, Delayed speech and language development, Intellectual disability, Seizure, Short stature, Bulbous nose, Narrow mouth, Macrotia, Long eyelashes, Long philtrum, Narrow palpebral fissure, Anteverted nares, Short nose, Broad eyebrow, Pointed chin, Brachycephaly, Small hand, Broad foot, Clinodactyly, Bifid uvula, Slender long bone, Osteopenia, Delayed skeletal maturation, Recurrent respiratory infections, Strabismus, Tube feeding.
Excluded patient features: Sleep onset insomnia, Developmental regression, Sparse eyebrow, High palate, Blepharochalasis, Broad nasal tip, Epicanthus, Long palpebral fissure, Long face, Frontal bossing, Broad forehead, Full cheeks, Retrognathia, Prominent tragus, Short philtrum, Preauricular pit, Everted lower lip vermilion, Thin upper lip vermilion, Highly arched eyebrow, Micrognathia, Periorbital fullness, Smooth philtrum, Low-set ears, Wide mouth, Prominent nose, Frontal upsweep of hair, Abnormally large globe, Downslanted palpebral fissures, Depressed nasal ridge, Thick lower lip vermilion, Prominent nasal bridge, Triangular face, Mandibular prognathia, Hypertelorism, Protruding ear, Wide nasal bridge, Coarse facial features, Tented upper lip vermilion, Proptosis, Tapered finger, Toe syndactyly, Sandal gap, Single transverse palmar crease, Short palm, Bilateral camptodactyly, Arachnodactyly, Pes planus, Broad distal phalanx of finger, Deep plantar creases, Cleft lip, Short uvula, Joint hypermobility, Sagittal craniosynostosis, Metopic synostosis, Esodeviation, Atrial septal defect, Pneumothorax, Pectus excavatum of inferior sternum, Striae distensae, Hypermetropia, Cubitus valgus, Vomiting, Recurrent otitis media, Asthma, Ankyloglossia, Gastroesophageal reflux, Primary amenorrhea, Syringomyelia, Cryptorchidism, Hirsutism, Aortic aneurysm, Duane anomaly, Constipation, High myopia, Hyperhidrosis.

eval_chain.query_summary: This query searches for diseases (biolink_Disease) that are associated with any of a list of 30 phenotypic features (biolink_PhenotypicFeature) observed in the patient. It matches diseases that have at least one of these features, counts how many features each disease matches, and returns the top 20 diseases with the highest number of matching features, ordered by match count. This approach is appropriate for generating a rank-ordered list of possible diagnoses based on the patient's observed features. The query uses an ORDER BY clause to prioritize diseases with the most overlapping features, which aligns with the user's request for a rank-ordered list. The relationships are oriented correctly, as it looks for diseases that 'have' the phenotypes. However, the query does not account for excluded features (features the patient does NOT have), nor does it use the biolink_subclass_of pattern to include disease subtypes, which could improve comprehensiveness. The query also does not use OPTIONAL MATCH, but this is acceptable here since we want only diseases with at least one matching phenotype. The result aligns with expectations, showing diseases with high overlap to the patient's features. The query passes a sanity check for the intended purpose, but could be improved by filtering out diseases with excluded features and by including subclasses.
eval_chain.suggestion: To improve the query, consider excluding diseases that are associated with any of the patient's excluded features. Also, use the biolink_subclass_of*0.. pattern to include all subtypes of diseases. Limit the results to 10 as per the instructions, unless more are specifically requested.

messages.content: {'result_as_graph': {'type': 'graph', 'data': {'nodes': [{'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0060760', 'caption': 'intellectual developmental disorder with dysmorphic facies and behavioral abnormalities', 'name': 'intellectual developmental disorder with dysmorphic facies and behavioral abnormalities', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014213', 'caption': 'intellectual disability-feeding difficulties-developmental delay-microcephaly syndrome', 'name': 'intellectual disability-feeding difficulties-developmental delay-microcephaly syndrome', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0013256', 'caption': 'chromosome 15q24 deletion syndrome', 'name': 'chromosome 15q24 deletion syndrome', 'description': '15q24 microdeletion syndrome is a rare chromosomal anomaly characterized cytogenetically by a 1.7-6.1 Mb deletion in chromosome 15q24 and clinically by pre- and post-natal growth retardation, intellectual disability, distinct facial features, and genital, skeletal, and digital anomalies.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0012864', 'caption': 'chromosome 2q32-q33 deletion syndrome', 'name': 'chromosome 2q32-q33 deletion syndrome', 'description': '2q32q33 microdeletion syndrome is a recently described syndrome characterized by a variable phenotype involving moderate to severe intellectual deficit, significant speech delay, persistent feeding difficulties, growth retardation and dysmorphic features.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0011518', 'caption': 'Wiedemann-Steiner syndrome', 'name': 'Wiedemann-Steiner syndrome', 'description': 'Wiedemann-Steiner syndrome is a rare genetic condition characterized by distinctive facial features, hairy elbows, short stature, and intellectual disability. This condition is caused by changes (mutations) in the KMT2A gene (also known as the MLL gene). It is inherited in an autosomal dominant manner. Most cases result from new (de novo) mutations that occur only in an egg or sperm cell, or just after conception. Treatment is symptomatic and supportive and may include special education classes and speech and occupational therapies aimed at increasing motor functioning and language.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0010407', 'caption': 'intellectual disability, X-linked syndromic, Turner type', 'name': 'intellectual disability, X-linked syndromic, Turner type', 'description': 'An X-linked syndromic intellectual disability characterized by moderate to severe intellectual deficit in boys and moderate intellectual deficit in girls. It has been described in 14 members from four generations of one family. Macrocephaly was reported and holoprosencephaly may also be present (two family members). The mode of transmission is X-linked semi-dominant.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014379', 'caption': 'ADNP-related multiple congenital anomalies - intellectual disability - autism spectrum disorder', 'name': 'ADNP-related multiple congenital anomalies - intellectual disability - autism spectrum disorder', 'description': 'An autosomal dominant non-syndromic intellectual disability that has material basis in an autosomal dominant mutation of ADNP on chromosome 20q13.13.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0009910', 'caption': 'Wiedemann-Rautenstrauch syndrome', 'name': 'Wiedemann-Rautenstrauch syndrome', 'description': 'Wiedemann-Rautenstrauch syndrome is a very rare disorder with features of premature aging recognizable at birth, decreased subcutaneous fat, hypotrichosis, relative macrocephaly and dysmorphism.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0007617', 'caption': 'Coffin-Siris syndrome 1', 'name': 'Coffin-Siris syndrome 1', 'description': 'Any Coffin-Siris syndrome in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the ARID1B gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0030914', 'caption': 'Clark-Baraitser syndrome', 'name': 'Clark-Baraitser syndrome', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0011053', 'caption': 'intellectual disability-sparse hair-brachydactyly syndrome', 'name': 'intellectual disability-sparse hair-brachydactyly syndrome', 'description': 'Intellectual disability-sparse hair-brachydactyly syndrome is a very rare condition of unknown etiology consisting of short stature, hypotrichosis, brachydactyly with cone-shaped epiphyses, epilepsy and severe mental delay. After the initial delineation of this syndrome by Nicolaides and Baraitser in 1993, only five more patients were published in the literature up to now.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0011929', 'caption': 'chromosome 1p36 deletion syndrome', 'name': 'chromosome 1p36 deletion syndrome', 'description': 'A chromosomal anomaly characterized by distinctive facial dysmorphic features, hypotonia, developmental delay, intellectual disability, seizures, heart defects, hearing impairment and prenatal onset growth deficiency.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014606', 'caption': 'intellectual disability-microcephaly-strabismus-behavioral abnormalities syndrome', 'name': 'intellectual disability-microcephaly-strabismus-behavioral abnormalities syndrome', 'description': 'Intellectual disability-microcephaly-strabismus-behavioral abnormalities syndrome is a rare, genetic, syndromic intellectual disability disorder characterized by craniofacial dysmorphism (microcephaly, hypotonic facies, strabismus, long and flat malar region, posteriorly rotated ears, flat nasal bridge with broad nasal tip, short philtrum, thin vermillion border, open mouth with down-turned corners, high arched palate, pointed chin), global developmental delay, intellectual disability and variable neurobehavioral abnormalities (autism spectrum disorder, aggressiveness, self injury). Additional features include vision abnormalities and variable sensorineural hearing loss, as well as short stature, hypotonia and gastrointestinal manifestations (e.g. poor feeding, gastroesophageal reflux, constipation).', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014936', 'caption': 'ZTTK syndrome', 'name': 'ZTTK syndrome', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0012914', 'caption': 'chromosome 1q21.1 deletion syndrome', 'name': 'chromosome 1q21.1 deletion syndrome', 'description': '1q21.1 microdeletion syndrome is a newly described recurrent deletion syndrome with variable clinical manifestations but without the clinical picture of thrombocytopenia - absent radius (TAR) syndrome.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0012916', 'caption': 'chromosome 2p16.1-p15 deletion syndrome', 'name': 'chromosome 2p16.1-p15 deletion syndrome', 'description': '2p15p16.1 microdeletion syndrome is a recently described syndrome characterized by developmental delay and facial dysmorphism.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014205', 'caption': 'severe feeding difficulties-failure to thrive-microcephaly due to ASXL3 deficiency syndrome', 'name': 'severe feeding difficulties-failure to thrive-microcephaly due to ASXL3 deficiency syndrome', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0016033', 'caption': 'Cornelia de Lange syndrome', 'name': 'Cornelia de Lange syndrome', 'description': 'A rare syndrome characterized by low birth weight, delayed growth, intellectual disabillity, behavioral problems, and a distinctive facial appearance (thin, arched eyebrows, low set ears, small teeth, and small nose). The majority of cases are caused by mutations in the NIPBL gene. Less severe forms of the syndrome are caused by mutations in the SMC1A and SMC3 genes.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0013336', 'caption': 'chromosome 19p13.13 deletion syndrome', 'name': 'chromosome 19p13.13 deletion syndrome', 'description': '19p13.13 microdeletion syndrome is a rare partial autosomal monosomy characterized by global developmental delay, moderate intellectual disability, macrocephaly, overgrowth, hypotonia, and facial dysmorphism (frontal bossing, down-slanting palpebral fissures). Other associated features variably include ataxia, seizures, ventriculomegaly, ocular abnormalities (strabismus, optic nerve hypoplasia) and gastrointestinal problems (abdominal pain, vomiting, constipation).', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0859143', 'caption': 'Radio-Tartaglia syndrome', 'name': 'Radio-Tartaglia syndrome', 'description': 'A syndrome that is caused by a variation in the SPEN gene and is characterized by developmental delay/intellectual disability, autism spectrum disorder, anxiety, aggressive behavior, attention deficit disorder, hypotonia, brain and spine anomalies, congenital heart defects, high/narrow palate, facial dysmorphisms, and obesity/increased BMI, especially in females.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}], 'edges': []}}, 'result_as_table': {'type': 'table', 'data': []}}
messages.name: run_query

messages.content:
Based on the patient's features and the knowledge graph, here is a rank-ordered list of possible diagnoses. These are selected because they match a high number of the patient's features, especially the combination of intellectual disability, microcephaly, developmental delay, dysmorphic facial features, hypotonia, autistic behavior, seizures, and feeding difficulties. The list is ordered by the number of matching features and clinical relevance:

1. [Intellectual developmental disorder with dysmorphic facies and behavioral abnormalities](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0060760)
2. [Intellectual disability-feeding difficulties-developmental delay-microcephaly syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0014213)
3. [Chromosome 15q24 deletion syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0013256)
4. [Chromosome 2q32-q33 deletion syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0012864)
5. [Wiedemann-Steiner syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0011518)
6. [Intellectual disability, X-linked syndromic, Turner type](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0010407)
7. [ADNP-related multiple congenital anomalies - intellectual disability - autism spectrum disorder](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0014379)
8. [Wiedemann-Rautenstrauch syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0009910)
9. [Coffin-Siris syndrome 1](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0007617)
10. [Clark-Baraitser syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0030914)

These syndromes are all associated with the core features seen in your patient. The top diagnoses are especially likely if the patient has a combination of intellectual disability, microcephaly, global developmental delay, dysmorphic facial features, hypotonia, autistic behavior, seizures, and feeding/respiratory difficulties.

If you have genetic testing results or additional clinical details, these could help further narrow the diagnosis. If you would like more information about any of these syndromes or a comparison of their features, please let me know!
